alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Garza; Lubbock; Lynn; Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 1:49PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Lubbock, northern Lynn, northwestern Garza, northeastern Terry and southwestern Crosby Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 149 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Ransom Canyon to near Slide. Movement was southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Slaton, Wolfforth, Ransom Canyon, Southland, Slide, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Woodrow, Wilson, Buffalo Springs, New Home and Lubbock Science Spectrum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
